title: Quiz 1 - Data Sufficiency
instruction: Directions (Q. 21 – 25): Each of the questions below consists of a question and two statements numbered I and II given below it. You have to decide whether the data provided in the statements are sufficient to answer the question. Read both the statements and give answer.

quiz.text:
How is ‘also’ written in a code language?

I. ‘He also show data’ is written as ‘sx fa mn ca’ and ‘now many person also’ is written as ‘zb ct sx ya’ in that code language.

II. ‘she visit the also’ is written as ‘sx im nc ty’ and ‘she visit the always’ is written as ‘im kc ty nc’ in that code language.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text:
Point Q is in which direction with respect to Point P?

I. Point P is east of Point L. Point L is north of Point M. Point M is west of Point N. Point N is south of Point O. Point O is west of Point Q.

II. Point L is west of Point P and north of Point M. Point M is east of Point N, which is south of Point O. Point Q is north east of Point N, which is southwest of Point L.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II are not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text:
Six persons, viz A, B, C, D, E and F are sitting at a circular table for lunch. Who among them sits on the immediate left of F (if all the persons are facing towards the centre)?

I. A sits third to the right of F. one person sits between A and C. E sits third to the left of C.

II. Only one person sits between E and D. F sits second to the right of D. A sits third to the left of F.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text:
Sharvan’s birthday is which of the following months?

I. Sharvan’s mother correctly remembers that his birthday will come after September but not in a month which has 30 days.

II. Sharvan’s father correctly remember that Sharvan’s birthday will not come in the first or last month of the year.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text:
How is A related to B?

I. B is brother of C, who is daughter of A.

II. D is husband of A.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text:
In which direction is A with respect to B?

I. B is towards north of C.

II. B is towards south of D, which is towards west of A.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text:
Among A, B, C, D and E, who is the lightest?

I. C is heavier than A.

II. D is lighter than B but heavier than C and E.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text:
Four persons A, B, C and D are sitting around a circular table facing the centre. What is the position of A with respect to C?

I. C sits second to the left of D. C sits on the immediate left of B.

II. B sits on the immediate right of C. A is the immediate neighbour of both C and D.
options: If the data in both statement I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text:
Is P father of V?

I. L is mother of V and O. W is the only sister of V. X is married to O. X is daughter-in-law of P.

II. P has only one daughter W. W is sister of V and O. O is son of L. X is daughter-in-law of L. X is sister-in-law of V.
options: If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are necessary to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.

quiz.text:
Six persons are sitting in two parallel rows containing three people each in such a way that there is an equal distance between adjacent persons. In row – 1, D, E and F are seated and all of them face south. In row – 2, O, L and Q are seated and all of them face north. Who among them faces Q?

I. D faces the one who sits on the immediate right of Q. D is not an immediate neighbour of F.

II. Only one person sits between O and L. The one who faces E sits on the immediate left of L.
options: If the data in both statement I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are necessary to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.

quiz.text:
How is J related to Q?

I. J is son of B’s father’s sister. O is son of Q, who is mother of U and grandmother of B. Q has one son and one daughter.

II. O is father of L and grandfather of J. who is the only son of L. Q is wife of O, who has only one daughter.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text:
Eight persons A, B, C, D, E, F, G and H are sitting around a circle, facing the centre. What is position F with respect to G?

I. D sits second to the right of H, who sits third to the right of A. B sits opposite C, who is an immediate neighbour of H.

G is not an immediate neighbour of either B or C. F is not an immediate neighbour of B.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text:
Among the P, Q, R, S and T who is the oldest?

I. Q is either younger than or equal to P. S is equal to R, who is younger than Q.

II. P is older than T, who is younger than S. R is equal to S and older than T.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text:
What is the P’s rank from the top?

I. In a class of 30 students, J is placed fifth from the bottom, whereas C is placed eighth from the top. P is placed exactly between J and C.

II. J is placed sixth below Q. Q is eight places below E.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text:
Is A greater than B?

I. A is two times B.

II. B is less than C, which is more than A.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are necessary to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.

quiz.text:
How is M related to S?

I. M is the only grandson of S’s father-in-law.

II. S has no sibling.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text:
Among D, A, G, H and E, who secured to highest marks?

I. E secured more marks than G and H but less marks than D, who did not secure the highest marks.

II. A secured more marks than H and E, and G secured less marks than E.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text:
P, Q, R, S, T and U are sitting in a straight line, facing north. Who among them sits second to the left of R?

I. Q sits third to the left of T, who sits at an extreme end of the line. Only one person sits between Q and S.

II. R is not an immediate neighbour of either T or U. U sits at an extreme end of the line.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text:
How is A related to B?

I. C has two children but has only one son. A is brother of D.

II. B is father-in-law of C. E is father of D, who is granddaughter of B.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text:
In which city does T live among cities B, C, D, E and F? only one person lives in each city.

I. R and J live in the city F and C respectively. T does not live in the city D.

II. Q lives in either city B or E.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text:
How is ‘more’ coded in a code language?

I. ‘more of its book’ is coded as ‘sx pi ko fe’ and ‘all book and cash’ is coded as ‘ga to zu ko’.

II. ‘its point for origin’ is coded as ‘ba le fe mi’ and ‘make of point clear’ is coded as ‘mi sx de si’.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text:
Point P is in which direction with respect to Point Q?

I. Point R is to the west of Point Q. Point S is to the north of Point Q. P is to the south of Point S.

II. T is to the south of Point P. Point T is 4m from Point Q and Point P is 9m far from Point Q.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are necessary to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.

quiz.text:
Are all the friends P, Q, R and S, who are sitting around a circular table, facing the centre?

I. Q sits to the right of S, who faces the centre. R sits on the immediate right of both Q and S.

II. P sits on the immediate left of Q. R is not on the immediate left of P. R sits on the immediate right of S.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text:
Who is daughter-in-law of P?

I. R is brother of N. T is son of N. S is mother of T.

II. P is wife of U. U is father of N. U has two children.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text:
Among six people A, B, C, D, E and F, each lives on a different floor a six-storey building. The ground floor is numbered 1 and the top most floor is no. 6. Who lives on the topmost floor?

I. E does not live on an even-numbered floor. B lives on an even-numbered floor but not on the topmost floor.

II. D lives on an odd-numbered floor. There are two floors between the floors on which D and A live. E lives on an floor immediately above C’s floor.
options: If the data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question.
If the data in both statement I and II together are necessary to answer the question.
